chapter.title: RHU classes
chapter.para: If you know of any good Red Hat University classes that are useful in teaching similar principles to those covered in The Open Source Way, add them here. Optionally, add them to the page, where content for this page is discussed.

section.title: TCL 001 - The Free Software Movement and the GNU/Linux Operating System
section.para: Description: GNU founder and free software icon explains the origins and successes of the Free Software Foundation and GNU/Linux. Delivered via RealMedia video
Abstract: A lecture by Richard Stallman, provided by ArsDigita University (ADU) at http://www.aduni.org and released under the Creative Commons (http://creativecommons.org) Open Content License.

section.title: TCL100 - The Fedora Message
section.para: Description: Warren Togami discusses the Fedora Project, how it came to be, and how you can become involved in the project's future.

section.title: The Open Source Way course
section.para: The Community Architecture team is working on a course based on The Open Source Way, probably offered as a virtual learning and an optional instructor-led training.
